results.title: Aida
results.creator_credit: Stephane Tchalgadjieff, Daniele Gegauff and Pierre Jourdan
results.brief_description:
This version of Verdi’s ‘Aida’ was recorded at the antique theatre of Orange (France). The stage direction is by Sandro Segui, decors by Pier-Luigi Pizi and choreography by Jacques Garnier. The Orchestra ‘Lirico di Torino’ is conducted by Thomas Schippers.

Credits: Cast: Producers, Stephane Tchalgadjieff, Daniele Gegauff ; director, Pierre Jourdan ; photography, Jean-Pierre Lazar.
Cast: Gilda Cruz-Romo, Grace Bumbry, Peter Gougalov.

results.title: Aida
results.creator_credit: Radiotelevisione Italiana, Polivideo, Giancarlo Sbragia and Brian Large
results.brief_description: This is a magnificent production on an epic scale of Giuseppe Verdi’s “Aida”, libretto by Antonio Ghislanzoni, recorded live at the Arena di Verona in 1981. Written by Verdi for the new Cairo Opera House which had been built to mark the opening of the Suez Canal, “Aida” is set in the golden time of the Egyptian Pharaohs and tells a tale of human drama and emotional conflict, of love, jealousy and manipulation culminating in a climax of tragedy. The lead singers include Maria Chiara (Aida), Fiorenza Cossotto (Amneris), Nicola Martinucci (Radames) and Giuseppe Scandola (Amonasro) accompanied by the Arena di Verona Chorus led by Corrado Mirandola, Orchestra conducted by Anton Guadagne and Corps de Ballet dancers Ileana Iliascu, Rosalba Garavelli, Georg Iancu and Richard Dusquenoy. Vittorrio Rossi’s stage sets and costumes are rich in color and design and the setting of the Arena di Verona is wonderfully atmospheric. Sung in Italian with no English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Radiotelevisione Italiana, Polivideo, Giancarlo Sbragia and Brian Large

results.title: Ai qing wan sui = Vive l'amour [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Central Motion Pictures Corporation, Sunny Overseas, Shiung Fa Films, Ligong Xu and Tsai Ming-liang
results.brief_description: A film to capture the senses “Vive L’amour” is visually stylistic and narratively minimalist, where long silences are interrupted by the sound of running water, a cassette tape being inserted into a recorder, the inhaling of a cigarette or the intense breathing of one in the act of committing suicide. It is a tale of three lost souls in the equally soul-less modern city of Taipei whose lives repeatedly and unwittingly cross paths in the same uptown luxury, albeit sterile, apartment: Hsaio-kang (Lee Kang-sheng), a gay salesman of crematorium niches coming to terms with his own homosexuality, Ah-jung (Chen Chao-jung) a street hawker of imitation designer goods and Mai Lin (Yang Kuei-mei) a struggling real estate agent. A sense of desperation lingers beneath the normality of routine daily life of each of the protagonists, drawing the three together and enmeshing their souls in a most unlikely liaison. Evocative and melancholic, “Vive L’amour” is beautifully directed by Tsai Ming Liang (The River) who is recognised as a major player in the New Taiwanese Cinema, with superb cinematography by Liao Peng-Jung and Lin Ming-Kuo. (Award: Golden Lion at the 1994 Venice Film Festival) In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Ah...we humans
results.brief_description: A non-narrated, animated cartoon with humorous sound effects, giving an understanding of how people react when confronted with behaviour patterns different from their own. Deals with a number of concepts related to groups and conflict: cultural awareness, beliefs and ignorance, scarce resources and the value of alliances. No other credits available.

results.title: Aguirre: wrath of God
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog Filmproduktion and Werner Herzog
results.brief_description: A stunning and gruelling adventure about a band of Spanish conquistadors led by Aguirre, and their descent into the heart of darkness while exploring the Amazon in search of El Dorado, the legendary city of Gold. As the expedition moves further into the jungle, they leave reality behind and enter a dreamlike, otherwordly land of delusion and madness. In German with English subtitles. Cast includes Klaus Kinski, Cecilia Rivera, Ruy Guerra, Helena Rojo, Del Negro and Daniel Zacapa. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Agronomy
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Raymond Garceau and Jean Palardy
results.brief_description: Describes the introduction of co-operative dairy farming in the eastern townships of Quebec to increase agricultural output and improve marketing methods. Recalls some of the difficulties encountered in the early days of the Agricultural Co-operative of Granby and cites the success of the Granby Co-operative as an example of what can be achieved when agricultural expert and farmer work in close co-operation.

results.title: Agriculture, industry and power
results.creator_credit: Warner-Pathe News and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Atoms for Peace”.
Describes research into the practical and beneficial uses of atomic energy and radioactive materials in agricultural and industrial production. Highlights Gama rays being used to develop better crop species, radioactive cobalt assisting fertiliser research, atomic energy detecting flaws in castings, checking wear on piston rings and, food preservation, synthetic fuel and electric power applications.

results.title: Agriculture today in Japan
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Productions for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the modern methods widely used in Japanese agriculture due to the influence of the country’s increasing industrialisation. Illustrates scientific farming methods, co-operative production and marketing.

results.title: Agriculture in Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the highly organized and productive farming methods of Japan, a small, densely populated country where every available square foot of land is valued. Profiles rice planting and its cultivation, stressing the high quotient of manual labour used in Japanese agricultural methods. The different kinds of produce are clearly defined and their cultivation topically treated.
